author: Amrith Ramkumar
title: Gold Edges Lower as Stocks Rise, Rate Concerns Remain
text:
Gold prices inched lower Monday, with stocks rising, as focus shifted away from the geopolitical and economic risks that had worried investors in recent sessions.
Front-month gold for March delivery fell 0.2% to $1,319.40 a troy ounce on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange. Prices have stayed between roughly $1,305 and $1,360 this year, swinging based on investorsâ€™ risk appetites, moves in the dollar and concerns about higher interest rates.
